newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Jordan mulls joint Tunisian-Jordanian bank.
newsitem.headline: Jordan mulls joint Tunisian-Jordanian bank.

text.p: Jordanian Prime Minister Abdul-Salam al-Majali proposed on Saturday setting up of a joint Tunisian-Jordanian bank to boost trade between the two countries.
"We consider that this bank would be a fundamental step in the relations between Jordan and Tunisia," Majali said.
He would not elaborate on the possible shareholders of the bank. Jordanian officials in Majali's entourage said the idea had not yet reached the stage of a project.
Majali said that he also discussed with Tunisian officials fields for bilateral economic cooperation such as tourism, as well as inter-Arab relations and the Middle east peace process.
During his visit, Majali held talks with his Tunisian counterpart Hamed Karoui and was received by President Zine al-Abidine Ben Ali.
Tunisia and Jordan in 1995 and 1996 signed accords on cooperation in the economic, trading, scientific and technical fields, agriculture, maritime transport, tourism and investments.
